newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-BLACKBURN TURN DOWN UNITED BID FOR BERG.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BLACKBURN TURN DOWN UNITED BID FOR BERG.

text.p: Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson has admitted he is unlikely to sign any new players to try to help United win the European Cup before Wednesday's competition transfer deadline.
Ferguson was confirming that United had failed in a bid to sign Norwegian defender Henning Berg from nearby Blackburn for 5.0 million pounds ($8.5 million).
Blackburn told United they did not want to sell Berg after recovering form in recent weeks following their poor start to the season.

Berg, who played a big part in Blackburn's best-of-season 4-0 win over Coventry on Saturday has been a key influence in the revival, which has seen them climb from bottom place to 14th in the standings.

Ferguson said: "We made an inquiry for Berg, but that's all finished now. I don't suppose we will get anyone by Wednesday. It is difficult to find players who are not cup-tied. I think 268 clubs have played in Europe this season and trying to find a player of the quality we are looking for who has not played in Europe is a hard job."
Meanwhile another Scandinavian has joined the growing ranks of players from Norway, Sweden and Denmark playing in the premier league.
Swede Marino Ramberg has joined Derby on loan from Degerfors with a view to a permanent move.
